Building upon the greatness of the first game, Portal 2 is a great adventure that will challenge you even more than before. It starts off slowly, re-familiarising you with the mechanics of the first game amongst the ruins of the Aperture Science facility, going through test chambers you played in the first game (albeit, a lot more dilapidated now). But soon, the game changes once again and you have to face more challenging test chambers, with a little help (but not much) from the core that woke you up and wants to help you escape, Wheatley (voiced by the brilliant Stephen Merchant). About halfway through though, the game changes entirely, widening the scope of everything entirely. You have to get to grips with some totally new mechanics, and you learn a lot more about the history of Aperture and GLaDOS along the way. A great game, with some amazing voice acting once again from Ellen McLain (as GLaDOS) and Stephen Merchant. Just brilliant.

Quite possibly the best game ever. Certainly up there with Sjyrim, Halflife 2, and all my other favorites. It has excellent graphics, voice characterizations, and puzzles. My favorite genre is fps but this is completely different and I loved it. As a bonus, it's really funny.

I write this review while listening to the mindblowing soundtrack of this perfect game. And I really do mean perfect. I first played it in 2011, and nothing to date has surpassed it for me. Don't believe me? Explanation: I first bought this masterpiece knowing nothing about the story or franchise. I just saw the commercial, and it kept mentioning science, so I figured it would be pretty good. Lord Gaben, was I wrong. It surpassed 'pretty good.' To call it that would be disrespectful. It gave me nerdgasms within the first minute. Why do I love it? Because it loves me. It touches on fields that are very dear to me, all with an awesome vibe. It explores robotics, psychology, chemical engineering, and art with a cynical-yet-unbelievably-intelligent voice. It is simultaneously an absurdist sci-fi game and a pshychological horror experience. Beneath the incredibly dark witticisms of GlaDOS, there is a somewhat disturbing theme of death and insanity, and in fact, this is actually the primary message in the first game. On a side note, people who scoff at Aperture's ridiculous policies that are too funny and bizzare to be true, think again. The founder of the company, the Venerable Cave Johnson, had a sense of humor and a disregard for the lives of his employees and for federal regulations, so, naturally, he built the facility to his meet his insane whims. I urge you to play the game from that standpoint. It is even better that way. Anyway, back to the actual review: the game also actually teaches you some science as Newtonian physics are often central to the puzzles, which led some schools to actually use the game as part of their science curriculum! I digress and ramble, so, to simplify and augment: This is a fantastic game with a fantastic story and first class writing and voice-acting that is actually perfect. Paired with a genius soundtrack, a ridiculously satisfying co-op, an innovative level designer and an astounding web-comic, this is a must-buy. Just get it. You'll thank me later.



P.S. I've played this game more hours than I have listed. I first owned it on the 360. That's right. It's so good, I willingly bought it twice.
Очень душевной получилась игра Portal2. Просто нет слов браво. Отдельная благодарность за музыкальные турели в конце.

It's so atmospheric, foreboding, and gives me a sense of exploring some creepy abandoned mega factory from the cold-war era. The graphics, sound, and voice acting are all well executed. The source engine is still one of the best. The story tie-in with the Half-Life series makes it all the more interesting.

[h1] Inspiration is a core element of this game.  [/h1]

After 2 yrs of the official release date, I have decided, to return to the Portal franchise. 
Specifically, after I've finished the first Portal, this one was affected me, like a propulsion-gel shot in the head.
All-long the storyline very interesting, and the player (for 2nd play as well!) still surprises in  every 5th minutes.
The improved graphics & the amazing graphics provides that 4x times better experience, than in the previous episode.

I loved how Cave Johnson's, GlaDOS's & Wheatley's character was described, presented to the player in details.
No mention about the insights of Aperture Science technologies, like the Turrent Manufacturing Plant (that was like "wooow"), or the abandoned, condemned and restricted area in a huugely different age (1963?), and more.
The platforms are well developed, as well the puzzles. So in words, I'd like to summarize pros & contras:

Pros:
[list]
    [*] Lovely inspiring & unique in-game soundtrack
    [*] Community made chambers easily accessible + Cooperative mode
    [*] The storyline impacts, brilliant.
    [*] From tech. glance, the graphics quality, and the work of the level designers are masterpieces.
    [*] Gels, advanced animations, panels, robots etc.

[/list]

Negatives:
[list]
    [*] I wish, there would any sign of a 3rd Portal announcement from Valve.
    [*] In the second half of the game, you probably experience some complex & difficult tasks / puzzles to perform.
    [*] At first play, some parts could be difficult for players coming outside of Portal
[/list]

A successor to the award-winning puzzle game. The story is much better than the first game, and it stands alone. You don't need to have played Portal all the way through to understand the story of Portal 2, but I would recommend it, as it adds something a little more to the experience. The puzzles are absolutely solid, but can be frustrating at times (there's a bit in the middle of the game that's really confusing). 

The voice acting cast is great. The reason I played all the way through this game was simply for the dialogue. I must applaud Steven Merchant for his awesome portrayal of Wheatley, your little buddy robot.

All in all, a great game that no other company but Valve could have pulled off, but they made sure there was no room for a sequel with the series' protagonist (not that they needed to, it's not like Valve can count to 3 anyways).

This game was one of the greatest games i have ever played! Me and my friend ended up playing it for half of the day trying to knock out multiplayer. I had been looking for months for a game that wasn't just Rated M and about shooting and killing non-stop, and finally i found one! At first when I heard that it was a puzzle game I was hesitant because I don't like puzzles and never have taken an interest, but this game has proven me wrong! The singleplayer and multiplayer sequences are like playing the game twice! Once you get into it each puzzle gets more complicated but more fun to complete! My dad has even taken a liking to this game. To me there is no downside but I can see how this game could be upsetting to people with little patience. Overall I give this game a 10/10 and hope you guys will too!

我喜欢这个系列。虽然是FPS，但我觉得它其实是解谜游戏中数一数二的经典，特别是第一部。
第二部地图更大，关卡更多，而且解谜的过程也挺有趣的，而且最主要的一点是它根本不吓人。前几关眼前所见的就是白墙白砖，还有蓝色和橙色的传送门。就算是掉进以前的废墟里面所见之景也比某些恐怖游戏赏心悦目。
因为找不到基友一起玩多人，所以我单人通关之后的感受是：阀门多久出3啊，哪怕是出个《半条命3：传送门》也好，雪儿与戈登一起打外星人什么的也行啊，传送枪+重力枪的组合也很赞啊啊啊啊……可惜G胖不会数3QWQ
BTW，比起前作，我喜欢这一作的GLaDOS，特别是她被安在土豆上之后（暗示育碧の土豆服务器是存在的（喂
p.s.3D眩晕患者还是别玩这个了，我基友玩了这个之后晕吐了。

Увлекательная и разнообразная логическая игра, требующая внимательности и нестандартных действий. В отличие от первого Портала акцент сделан на поиске правильного алгоритма а не на скорости реакции и ловкости. Захватывающий командный режим с неожиданными решениями. И, конечно, безупречное чувство юмора разработчиков.

[h1] Muy bueno, aunque siempre hay algún pero.[/h1]
Lo primero, decir que tanto en aspectos de mecánicas como de historia el juego es muy bueno. Sé que cuadraría un perfecto, pero siento que dadas que este tipo de críticas se han dado mucho (sin intención de ofender), me pareció adecuado dar los "peros". Primero, las dinámicas de juego. Lo que he de decir es, si bien son originales y están sin duda trabajadas, están como "metidas con calzador". [spoiler]Los geles, por ejemplo, cuadran poco con la anterior parte del juego[/spoiler] y hay lugares donde se siente que las "paredes desintegradoras" (lo siento, no recuerdo el nombre) no tienen más sentido que el puzle o el mapa. Vamos, que el diseño de nivel está al rededor de los puzles y no al revés en la mayor parte de los casos. La segunda parte es la historia. Podría perfectamente acabar en muchos otros puntos del juego, y pienso que está realmente mal enlazado, mientras que los trozos individuales están muy bien hechos (lo que hay que decir, se dice). Eso sí, por encima de todo lo que he dicho y de los "peros" que le he puesto, quiero decir una cosa: Portal 2 es un juego MAGNÍFICO, y lo recomiendo a todo aquél que pueda permitírselo.
